lead_paragraph: FROM THE WESTERN PLAINS.--A party of gentlemen arrived at St. Louis on the 25th instant, in sixteen days from Fort Laramie. They were not molested on their journey by the Indians. They state that the ground assigned for meeting the Indians of the Prairies to form a treaty is thirty-five miles this side of Fort Laramie, where twelve thousand Indians were assembled.
